column5: Heading down from Barrie this week-end to the Niagara area. Should I be bringing the boat to get a few or 5 hours of fishing in or is the river all dirty? I've been checking the forecasts in that area and sounds like its been kind of windy.
She's gonna be chocolate milk..Still blowing hard here and the water was getting bad this morning.
I was over the peace bridge at noon today. Brown on the Ft Erie shore line, but green in the river. Winds here are still gusty, so50/50 for tomorrow
sounds like Saturday is a write-off in other words. Thanks for the update

Winds whipping down the lower at about 40 to 50k as of 1 1/2 hr ago it was still a nice green and fishable. Talked to a few at the ramp they had a few browns and steelies...if this keeps up its a no go saturday though.
you can check my facebook page @ fishinniagara  for daily upper niagara updates
thanks denis, I'll check it out tomorrow before we head out to see if its worth taking the boat
i'll be posting a video around 8am
you can always take your chances--going to be a great weekend.
Give it a try. I was out in the glen all afternoon and picked up four nice steelhead. Best fishing i've seen down there yet.
too late, didn't end up bringing the boat. Good luck to everyone who gets out there
